column13: The policy reflects our vision to create an environment that is safe and inclusive and leverages the potential of our people irrespective of differences. Diversity and inclusion in the workplace improve our ability to attract, retain, motivate and develop talent.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: The policy outlines standards of conduct, ethical behaviour, corporate compliance, and good corporate governance. Includes a framework of standards by which the directors, employees and contractors of EBOS and its related companies are expected to conduct their professional lives.
column20: Code of Ethics, Corporate Governance, Professional Lives

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: When we embrace equity, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We assume equity to forge harmony and unity and to help drive success for all. We created a celebration program during International Women's Day (IWD) in March to encourage conversation and drive further awareness of diversity and inclusion. We encouraged everyone at EBOS to take part.
column20: International Women's Day, Women's Health, Be Well From Anywhere

column13: Leadership involves harnessing and leveraging team membersÃ¢ÂÂ motivation to achieve common goals. The Leadership Standards create a consistent approach and expectation to leadership at EBOS, helping to develop and sustain a working environment conducive to business growth, enabling the best people and achieving excellent results. Over the last two years, we have collaborated with our leaders to identify the EBOS Leadership Standards, which underpin the GroupÃ¢ÂÂs purpose and vision. The objective of elaborating on these standards is to foster continuous professional learning and development among our senior managers and their teams.
column20: Leadership Standards, Group's Standards, Professional Learning

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: We implemented integrity training through an online learning platform to support our workforce in understanding our Group policies fully and confidently, upholding all legal and regulatory requirements relevant to their roles. All corporate employees participate in an annual training cycle on Whistle-blowing, Anti-bullying and anti-harassment, Worker Health and safety and the Code of Ethics. Selected employees, such as senior managers and those in Finance, Sales and Marketing roles, also complete additional training on Privacy, Fraud Awareness, Bribery and corruption, Anti-competitive Conduct, Consumer Protection, and Unfair Business Conduct every two years.
column20: Online Learning Platform, Group Policies, Annual Training Cycle

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: The training is a significant focus area for the Group's ESG Program in our ongoing attention to wellbeing, including psychological health. In 2023, we are introducing a new training suite to help eliminate prejudice and create more inclusive workspaces. We launched the first modules on Unconscious Bias in conjunction with International Women's Day. Employees from across the Group logged in to participate in virtual learning sessions focused on improving self-awareness about attitudes toward diversity.
